intro: Hieracium nemophilum, commonly known as the woodscentred hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and meadows, where it thrives in cool, damp conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium nemophilum is often found in association with other woodland flora, contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
